text: Gauri Khan () (n√©e Chibber, born 8 October 1970) is an Indian movie producer. A Hindu of Punjabi Mohyal origin, born in New Delhi, India. She graduated from Modern School, New Delhi and has a degree in History from Lady Sriram College. She is married to Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan.Rags-to-riches story of Bollywood superstar on DVD Gulf Times - September 25, 2005 She has produced some of the movies with her husband as the main actor, including Paheli (an unsuccessful Indian submission to the Oscars in 2005), Main Hoon Na, and Om Shanti Om. She also made a short guest appearance in Om Shanti Om.Gauri Steps Out Times of India She used to host a weekly Hindi music countdown show, "Oye", for a music channel in the 1990s. She is the face of the fashion line, Aftershock. She was on the January 2008 cover of the Indian edition of Vogue magazine.Gauri Khan, Vogue's Cover Girl Rediff.com Together with Shahrukh Khan, Gauri is part-owner and part-producer of the production company, Red Chillies Entertainment (RCE). Shah Rukh started the company for his friend and colleague, director-choreographer Farah Khan. With the backing of RCE, Farah launched her directorial career with the movie, Main Hoon Na (2004). Gauri has three children: Aryan Khan born 12 November 1997, Suhana Khan born 23 May 2000 and AbRam Khan born in 2013. She was also crowned the queen of Bollywood at the Zee Cine Awards in 2008. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Indian movie producers Category:People from New Delhi
title: Gauri Khan
